creator: jan-peter@jppietsch.de
text:
There is some code in package org.apache.batik.gvt.font which depends on the 
Java version. The Java version is checked via system property "java.version", 
which usually contains a numeric string like "1.3.1" for most Java VMs.

It appears that we use a virtual machine which identifies itself 
as "JPSE_1.3.1_20020313" (which is delivered with some versions of IBMs 
WebSphere on Solaris). The static initializer of class SVGGVTGlyphVector does a 
lexical comparison on this string and decides, that this version is higher 
than "1.4" because "JPSE">"1.4". This leads to errors in text output in 
generated images.

The problem may be solved by using the system 
property "java.specification.version" instead of "java.version".
Thanks this will be fixed soon in CVS.
creator: deweese@apache.org
